	<item>
				<title>&lt;span&gt;Shortcodes: &lt;/span&gt;Buttons &amp; Lists</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=15</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Mar 2014 07:37:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?page_id=15</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Shortcodes is a WordPress-specific code that lets you do nifty things with very little effort. Shortcodes can embed files or create objects that would normally require lots of complicated, ugly code in just one line. Shortcode = shortcut.</p>
 <h2>Buttons Options:</h2>
 <p>Use any of the available button classes to quickly create a styled link/button.</p>
<p>
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]default[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]primary[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-success" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]success[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-info" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]info[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-warning" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]warning[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-danger" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]danger[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-link" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]link[/button]
</p>
<p>
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-pink" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]pink[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-teal" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]teal[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-purple" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]purple[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-orange" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]orange[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-brown" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]brown[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-black" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]black[/button]
</p>
[code]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-pink" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]pink[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-teal" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]teal[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-purple" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]purple[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-orange" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]orange[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-brown" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]brown[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-black" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]black[/button]
[/code]
<h3>Disabled Buttons</h3>
<p>Add the <code>disabled</code> attribute to buttons to make them look unclickable (fading them back 50%)</p>
<p>
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default " disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]default[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]primary[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-success" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]success[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-info" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]info[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-warning" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]warning[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-danger" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]danger[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-link" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]link[/button]
</p>
<p>
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-pink" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]pink[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-teal" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]teal[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-purple" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]purple[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-orange" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]orange[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-brown" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]brown[/button] [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-black" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]black[/button]
</p>
[code]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-pink" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]pink[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-teal" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]teal[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-purple" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]purple[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-orange" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]orange[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-brown" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]brown[/button]
 [button target="_self" style="" class="btn-black" disabled="disabled" size="default" link="#"]black[/button]
[/code]
<h3>Buttons Size</h3>
<p>Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add <code>.btn-lg</code>, <code>.btn-sm</code>, or <code>.btn-xs</code> for additional sizes.</p>
<p>[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="large" link="#"]large size[/button]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="large" link="#"]large size[/button]</p>
<p>[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]default size[/button]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]default size[/button]</p>
<p>[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="small" link="#"]small size[/button]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="small" link="#"]small size[/button]</p><p>[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="extra" link="#"]extra small[/button]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="extra" link="#"]extra small[/button]</p>
[code]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="large" link="#"]large size[/button]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="large" link="#"]large size[/button]

[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]default size[/button]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="default" link="#"]default size[/button]

[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="small" link="#"]small size[/button]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="small" link="#"]small size[/button]

[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-default" disabled="active" size="extra" link="#"]extra small[/button]
[button target="_self" style="" class="btn-primary" disabled="active" size="extra" link="#"]extra small[/button]
[/code]

<p>

	<item>
				<title>&lt;span&gt;Shortcodes: &lt;/span&gt;Charts</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=20</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Mar 2014 07:40:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?page_id=20</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[raw]

                    <p>Charts shortocode allows you to easily insert charts into your blog. While multipurpose, the chart system is intended to make it easy for posting detailed review measurements of some sort, such as poll data, video card comparisons, sports scores, etc. You specify the names of the devices being measured, the tests performed, and each device's measurements for said test.</p>

<h2 class="shortcode_title">3D round pie</h2> 
[chart width="610" height="250" type="3dpie" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED" background="#fff"]
[code][chart width="540" height="250" type="3dpie" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED"][/code]
<h2 class="shortcode_title">Charts: 2D round pie</h2>
[chart width="610" height="250" type="pie" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED" background="#fff"]
[code][chart width="540" height="250" type="pie" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED"][/code]
<h2 class="shortcode_title">Line Chart</h2>
[chart width="540" height="250" type="line" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED" background="#fff"]
[code][chart width="540" height="250" type="line" title="The most popularity internet browser" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Internet Explorer|Firefox|Safari|Chrome|Others" colors="FF9900|E40B0B|1B9A1B|3399CC|BBCCED" background="#fff"][/code]
<h2 class="shortcode_title">Bar Chart</h2>
[chart width="610" height="250" type="bar" title="Monthly sales growth" data="30,30,30,30,30,30|50,50,50,50,50,50|100,100,100,100,100,100" legend="30|50|100" label="Jan.|Feb.|Mar.|Apr.|May|Jun." colors="FF9900|e40b0b|3399cc" background="#fff"]

[code][chart width="590" height="246" type="bar" title="Monthly sales growth" data="30,30,30,30,30,30|50,50,50,50,50,50|100,100,100,100,100,100" legend="30|50|100" label="Jan.|Feb.|Mar.|Apr.|May|Jun." colors="FF9900|e40b0b|3399cc" ][/code]
[/raw] ]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>&lt;span&gt;Shortcodes: &lt;/span&gt;Columns with Sidebar</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=22</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Mar 2014 07:41:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?page_id=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ <p>Sometimes you just need to divide your page into different columns. With this shortcode you just select a column and it will add the column to the page.</p>
[row]
[col type="6"]<h3>One half column</h3>
 <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="6"]<h3>One half column</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="8"] <h3>2/3 column</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
<p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]

[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]

[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>
                            <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper </p>[/col]
[col type="3"]<h3>1/4 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]
[col type="3"]<h3>1/4 column</h3>
<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]
[/row]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ <p>Sometimes you just need to divide your page into different columns. With this shortcode you just select a column and it will add the column to the page.</p>
[row]
[col type="6"]<h3>One half column</h3>
 <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="6"]<h3>One half column</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>
  <p>Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper.</p>[/col]
[/row]
[row]
[col type="8"] <h3>2/3 column</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies ac tempor dui sagittis</p>[/col]
[col type="4"]<h3>1/3 column</h3>

[/row]
[row]

<p>In condimentum facilisis porta. orci ac euismod semper. Vivamus luctus urna sed urna ultricies </p>[/col]

[col type="6"]<h3>1/2 column</h3>

		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=26</link>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>PrettyPhoto</strong> is a jQuery <strong>lightbox clone</strong>. Not only does it support images, it also support for videos, flash, YouTube, iframes and ajax. It's a full  blown media lightbox.</p>
 <h2>PrettyPhoto for Text</h2>
[prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/img_big_1.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class=""]Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]

[code][prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/img_big_1.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class=""]Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto][/code]

<h2 class="shortcode_title">Button prettyPhoto</h2>
[prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/img_big_2.jpg" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="btn-primary"]<span class="icon icon-zoom-in"></span>Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]

[code][prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/img_big_2.jpg" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="btn-primary"]Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto][/code]

<h2 class="shortcode_title">prettyPhoto for elements:</h2>
[prettyPhoto  title="Title Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/gavatar_1.jpg" type="link" ]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/gavatar_1.jpg" class="frame_box"  />[/prettyPhoto]

[code][prettyPhoto  title="Title Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/gavatar_1.jpg" type="link" ]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/gavatar_1.jpg" class="frame_box" width="219" height="140" />[/prettyPhoto][/code]

				<title>&lt;span&gt;Shortcodes: &lt;/span&gt;Google Maps</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=30</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Mar 2014 07:43:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?page_id=30</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Google Maps offers powerful, user-friendly mapping technology and local business information - including business locations, contact information, and driving directions.</p>
[map width="724" height="350" lat="41.887" long="-87.630" zoom="10" type="map1" address="" title="Default Google Maps view"]
[code][map width="724" height="350" lat="41.887" long="-87.630" zoom="10" type="map1" address="" title="Default Google Maps view"][/code]

[map width="724" height="350" lat="41.887" long="-87.630" zoom="10" type="map2" address="" title="Different Maps type : <span>HYBRID</span>"]
[code][map width="724" height="350" lat="41.887" long="-87.630" zoom="10" type="map2" address="" title="Different Maps type : HYBRID"][/code]

<p>The following types are supported:</p>
<div class="list_square">
<ul>
<li><strong>ROADMAP</strong> displays the normal, default 2D tiles of Google Maps.</li>
<li><strong>SATELLITE</strong> displays photographic tiles.</li>
<li><strong>HYBRID</strong> displays a mix of photographic tiles and a tile layer for prominent features (roads, city names).</li>
<li><strong>TERRAIN</strong> displays physical relief tiles for displaying elevation and water features (mountains, rivers, etc.).</li>
</ul>
</div>

[map width="724" height="400" lat="41.881831" long="-87.629814" zoom="7" type="map3" address="Chicago, IL, United States" title="Maps with marker and info window"]

[code][map width="724" height="400" lat="41.881831" long="-87.629814" zoom="7" type="map3" address="Chicago, IL, United States" title="Maps with marker and info window"][/code]]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>google-maps</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

	<item>
				<title>&lt;span&gt;Shortcodes: &lt;/span&gt;Tabs and Toggles</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=32</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Mar 2014 07:44:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?page_id=32</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>This is an example of Framed Tabs:</h2>
[tabs class=""][tab active="true" title="Tab 1"]<h2>Tab 1 Content</h2>
                                    <p>Phasellus molestie magna non est bibendum non venenatis nisl tempor. Suspendisse dictum feugiat nisl ut dapibus. Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. </p>[/tab][tab title="Tab 2"]<h2>Tab 2 Content</h2>
                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/mg_thumb_1.jpg" alt="" class="alignleft">
                                    <p>Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus</p>[/tab][tab title="Tab 3"]<h2>Tab 3 Content</h2>
                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/mg_thumb_2.jpg" alt="" class="alignright">
                                    <p>Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. </p>
                                    <p>Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet.</p>[/tab][/tabs]
<h2>Justified tabs, 2nd tab active</h2>
[tabs class=""  size="large" active="2"][tab title="Tab 1"]<h2>Tab 1 Content</h2>
                                    <p>Phasellus molestie magna non est bibendum non venenatis nisl tempor. Suspendisse dictum feugiat nisl ut dapibus. Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. </p>[/tab][tab active="true" title="Tab 2"]<h2>Tab 2 Content</h2>
                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/mg_thumb_1.jpg" alt="" class="alignleft">
                                    <p>Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus</p>[/tab][tab title="Tab 3"]<h2>Tab 3 Content</h2>
                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/mg_thumb_2.jpg" alt="" class="alignright">
                                    <p>Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. </p>

<h3>Contextual classes</h3>
                    <p>Use contextual classes to color table rows or individual cells.</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li><strong>.active</strong> - Applies the hover color to a particular row or cell</li>
                        <li><strong>.success</strong> - Indicates a successful or positive action</li>
                        <li><strong>.warning</strong> - Indicates a warning that might need attention</li>
                        <li><strong>.danger</strong> - Indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action</li>
                    </ul>
[table class="table-info"] <table class="table">
                            <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <th>Browser</th>
                                <th>Version</th>
                                <th>CSS Grade</th>
                                <th>Platform</th>
                            </tr>
                            </thead>
                            <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <td>default</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr class="active">
                                <td>active</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr class="success">
                                <td>success</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                            </tr>
                            <tr class="warning">
                                <td>warning</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>

                                <td>Col content</td>
                                <td>Col content</td>
                            </tr>
                            </tbody>
                        </table>[/table]

[code]
[table class="table-danger"]
    <table class="table">
         <thead>
            <tr>
               <th>Browser</th>
               <th>Version</th>
               <th>CSS Grade</th>
               <th>Platform</th>
            </tr>
         </thead>
         <tbody>
             <tr>
                <td>Firefox</td>
                <td>6.0.2</td>
                <td>AAA</td>
                <td>Win XP</td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
                <td>Internet Explorer</td>
                <td>8</td>
                <td>C</td>
                <td>Win Vista</td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
                <td>Chrome</td>
                <td>5</td>
                <td>BB</td>
                <td>Win 7</td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
                <td>Safari</td>
                <td>5</td>
                <td>AA</td>
                <td>Win 7</td>
             </tr>
         </tbody>
     </table>
[/table]
[/code]
<h2>Styled Boxes</h2>
                    <p>While not always necessary, sometimes you need to put your CONTENT in a box. For those situations, try the Box shortcode.</p>
<h3>Basic example</h3>
[styled_box title="" footer="" class="panel-default"]Basic panel example[/styled_box]
<h3>Box with heading</h3>
[styled_box title="Box Title" footer="" class="panel-default"]Box content[/styled_box]
<h3>Box with footer</h3>
[styled_box title="" footer="default" class="panel-default"]default - Box content[/styled_box]
<h3>Color versions:</h3>

                    <p>Can be combined with icons</p>
[styled_box title="Primary" icon="icon-home" footer="" class="panel-primary"]primary - Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="success" icon="icon-thumbs-up" footer="" class="panel-success"]success - Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="info" icon="icon-info-sign" footer="" class="panel-info"]info - Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="warning" icon="" footer="" class="panel-warning"]warning - Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="danger" icon="" footer="" class="panel-danger"]danger - Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="pink" icon="" footer="" class="panel-pink"]Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="teal" icon="" footer="" class="panel-teal"]Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="purple" icon="" footer="" class="panel-purple"]Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="orange" icon="" footer="" class="panel-orange"]Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="brown" icon="" footer="" class="panel-brown"]Box content[/styled_box]

[styled_box title="black" icon="" footer="" class="panel-black"]Box content[/styled_box]

[code]
[styled_box title="orange" icon="" footer="" class="panel-orange"]Box content[/styled_box]
[/code]
 <p><strong>[styled _box] colors: </strong>orange (default), pink, brown, violet, turquoise, green, blue, dark, purple, brown, cyan</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Paragraphs and Headings h1-h6</h2>

                                    <p>Duis mi nibh, <a href="#">varius sed suscipit</a> sed, pretium eget nulla. <em>Praesent faucibus libero</em> nec imperdiet euismod. Suspendisse ut erat sed diam <del>pretium cursus</del> quis blandit lorem. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. </p>

                                    <p>Nullam non consequat nunc, <strong>vel sagittis tellus</strong>. In ultrices leo quis metus posuere suscipit. Duis sollicitudin, dui non faucibus imperdiet, justo sapien aliquet sapien, vitae scelerisque enim tortor non ipsum. Donec libero neque, elementum nec faucibus quis, tempor id felis.</p>

                                    <p>All HTML headings, <code>&lt;h1&gt;</code> through <code>&lt;h6&gt;</code>, are available. <code>.h1</code> through <code>.h6</code> classes are also available, for when you want to match the font styling of a heading but still want your text to be displayed inline.</p>
[title type="h1"]Example of h1 tag[/title]
[title type="h2"]Example of h2 tag[/title]
[title type="h3"]Example of h3 tag[/title]
[title type="h4"]Example of h4 tag[/title]
[title type="h5"]Example of h5 tag[/title]
[title type="h6"]Example of h6 tag[/title]

[title type="h2"]<span>Span</span> inside Heading[/title]
[divider]

<h2>Alignment classes</h2>

                                    <p>Easily realign text to components with text alignment classes.</p>

                                    <p class="text-left">Left aligned text.</p>
                                    <p class="text-center">Center aligned text.</p>
                                    <p class="text-right">Right aligned text.</p>
                                    <p class="text-justify">Justified text.</p>
[divider]

<h2>Blockquotes</h2>
[blockquote]<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante.</p>
                                        <small>Someone famous in <cite title="Source Title">Source Title</cite></small>[/blockquote]
<h4>Reversed blockquote</h4>
[reverse_quote]<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante.</p>
                                        <small>Someone famous in <cite title="Source Title">Source Title</cite></small>[/reverse_quote]

<h4>Blockquote in Box</h4>
[blockquote_box]Example of emphasisied paragraph: I've gotten burned lorem ipsum over Cheryl Tiegs, blown up for Raquel Welch. But when I end up in the hay.[/blockquote_box]

<h4>Quotes Left/Right alignment</h4>
[quote_right]Example of emphasisied paragraph: I've gotten burned lorem ipsum over Cheryl Tiegs, blown up for Raquel Welch. But when I end up in the hay. [/quote_right]

<p>Conveniently target standardized technology without integrated processes. Appropriately plagiarize plug-and-play growth strategies vis-a-vis B2C expertise. Collaboratively productivate B2C communities whereas emerging benefits. Appropriately repurpose customer directed architectures via worldwide systems. Conveniently formulate cross-platform information before user friendly methodologies.</p>

                                     <p>Continually develop mission-critical manufactured products vis-a-vis impactful architectures. Assertively disseminate principle-centered platforms with out-of-the-box outsourcing. Enthusiastically syndicate web-enabled channels rather than value-added innovation. Quickly incentivize timely products after client-centered vortals. Monotonectally actualize multimedia based value without 24/7 testing procedures. Uniquely harness cross-platform opportunities via professional.</p>
[divider]
<h2>Drop Caps</h2>
<p>[dropcap1]T[/dropcap1] hunder, thunder, thundercats, Ho! Thundercats are on the move, Thundercats are loose. Feel the magic, hear the roar, Thundercats are loose. Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thundercats!</p>

<p>[dropcap2]H[/dropcap2]ey there where ya goin', not exactly knowin', who says you have to call just one place home. He's goin' everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin', ladies keep improvin', every day is better than the last. New dreams and lorem ipsum better scenes.</p>

[divider]

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Tooltips</h2>
 <p><strong>Hover over the links below to see tooltips:</strong></p>
<p>Phasellus [tooltip pos="top" toolt="First tooltip"]molestie magna[/tooltip] non est bibendum non venenatis nisl tempor. [tooltip pos="top" toolt="Second tooltip"]Suspendisse[/tooltip] dictum feugiat nisl ut dapibus. Mauris iaculis [tooltip pos="top" toolt="Another example of Tooltip with more text in it"]porttitor posuere[/tooltip]. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. </p>

 <h3>Tooltips can be set in 4 directions</h3>
<p>
[tooltip pos="top" toolt="Tooltip on Top"]Tooltip on Top[/tooltip] &nbsp; | &nbsp; [tooltip pos="bottom" toolt="Tooltip on Bottom"]Tooltip on Bottom[/tooltip] &nbsp; | &nbsp; [tooltip pos="right" toolt="Tooltip on Right"]Tooltip on Right[/tooltip] &nbsp; | &nbsp; [tooltip pos="left" toolt="Tooltip on Left"]Tooltip on Left[/tooltip]
</p>

<h2>Labels</h2>

                    <p>
<span class="label label-default">Default</span> <span class="label label-primary">Primary</span> <span class="label label-success">Success</span> <span class="label label-info">Info</span> <span class="label label-warning">Warning</span> <span class="label label-danger">Danger</span></p>

                    <p>Add any of the below mentioned modifier classes to change the appearance of a label.</p>

                    <h2>Example heading <span class="label label-default">New</span></h2>
                    <h3>Example heading <span class="label label-primary">New</span></h3>
                    <h4>Example heading <span class="label label-warning">New</span></h4>
                    <h5>Example heading <span class="label label-info">New</span></h5>
                    <h6>Example heading <span class="label label-danger">New</span></h6>

                    <p>You can even make them smaller:</p>

                    <h4>Example heading label-sm <span class="label label-info label-sm">New</span></h4>
                    <h4>Example heading label-xs <span class="label label-warning label-xs">NEW</span></h4>

                    <div class="tf_divider divider_space_thin "></div>
<h2>Alert messages</h2>

                    <p>Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages with <code>dismiss functionality</code>.</p>
[alert class="alert-success"]<strong>Well done!</strong> You successfully read this <a href="#" class="alert-link">important alert message</a>.[/alert]

[alert class="alert-info"]<strong>Heads up!</strong> This <a href="#" class="alert-link">alert needs your attention</a>, but it's not super important.[/alert]

[alert class="alert-warning"]<strong>Warning!</strong> Best check yo self, you're <a href="#" class="alert-link">not looking too good</a>.[/alert]

[alert class="alert-danger"]<strong>Oh snap!</strong> Change a few things up and <a href="#" class="alert-link">try submitting again</a>.[/alert]]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
				<title>GTA V Nominated for 9 BAFTA Game Awards</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=336</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 May 2014 13:18:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=336</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Grand Theft Auto Online will be down for maintenance for the best part of Thursday, Rockstar Games has announced. The online game will be taken offline from 2am GMT tomorrow]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>336</wp:post_id>

	<item>
				<title>Rockstar highlights 10 jobs in GTA Online</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=338</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 May 2014 13:20:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=338</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[This month’s cover feature dives into the stunning new vision for the Assassin’s Creed series as Black Flag takes gamers to the high seas; game director Ashraf Ismail reveals exclusive details Grand Theft Auto Online will be down for maintenance for the best part of Thursday, Rockstar Games has announced. The online game will be taken offline from 2am GMT tomorrow]]></excerpt:encoded>

				<title>GTA Online taken offline for maintenance</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=340</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 May 2014 13:21:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=340</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Dishonored</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=484</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:24:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=484</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Max Payne 3</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=486</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:25:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=486</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Curabitur vulputate, ligula lacinia scelerisque tempor, lacus lacus ornare ante, ac egestas est urna sit amet arcu. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Mass Effect 3</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=488</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:27:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=488</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Curabitur vulputate, ligula lacinia scelerisque tempor, lacus lacus ornare ante, ac egestas est urna sit amet arcu. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>LA Noire</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=490</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:28:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=490</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

				<title>Batman Arkum City</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=494</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:30:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=494</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>GTA Online taken offline for maintenance</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=496</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:31:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=496</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

	<item>
				<title>Tomb raider game of the year edition</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=498</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:32:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=498</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Assassin’s Creed IV</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=502</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:35:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=502</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Batman Arkum City</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=505</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 10:36:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=505</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

	<item>
				<title>The Transformers: Dark of the Moon</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=209</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2014 09:53:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=209</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Exotic cars and high-speed police chases</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=214</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2014 10:39:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=214</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>The Next Tomb Raider Story Starts</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=216</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2014 10:40:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=216</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>GTA 5 on PC is real and pre-orders will open up on Friday</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=218</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2014 10:41:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?p=218</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your.</p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
