	<item>
				<title>GTA 5 Reviews (PS3)</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=gta-5-reviews-ps3-6</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Apr 2014 06:47:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=903</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Grand Theft Auto Online Review</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:12:{s:20:"gameszone_video_links";s:62:"http://player.vimeo.com/video/69177078?byline=0&amp;portrait=0";s:20:"gameszone_game_select";s:3:"315";s:15:"gameszone_rating";s:1:"9";s:17:"gameszone_featured";s:5:"false";s:27:"gameszone_content_tabs_table";a:3:{i:0;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:72:"Innovative three-protagonist structure leads to loads of amazing moments";}i:1;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:68:"Outstanding, multilayered heists and other missions across the world";}i:2;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:66:"Huge, gorgeous, varied open world packed with things to see and do";}}s:29:"gameszone_content_tabs_table_s";a:3:{i:0;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:67:"Women are portrayed as strippers, prostitutes, long-suffering wives";}i:1;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:77:"There’s a terrific contrast between the urban lives of Michael and Franklin";}i:2;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:81:"Great vehicle handling makes traveling the world a pleasent and joyful experience";}}s:19:"gameszone_hide_title";s:5:"false";s:23:"gameszone_content_on_top";s:0:"";s:20:"gameszone_content_top";s:0:"";s:23:"gameszone_content_bottom";s:141:"[raw][section sect=&quot;row&quot; bg=&quot;white&quot; row=&quot;default&quot;][sliders slider_id=&quot;535a4d494f4ae&quot;][/section][/raw]";s:18:"gameszone_seo_title";s:0:"";s:24:"gameszone_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>

	<item>
				<title>GTA 5 Reviews (PS3)</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=gta-5-reviews-ps3-8</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Apr 2014 06:56:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=907</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it.                                     <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. 			<wp:meta_key>gameszone_tfuse_post_options</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:12:{s:20:"gameszone_video_links";s:62:"http://player.vimeo.com/video/69177078?byline=0&amp;portrait=0";s:20:"gameszone_game_select";s:3:"313";s:15:"gameszone_rating";s:2:"10";s:17:"gameszone_featured";s:5:"false";s:27:"gameszone_content_tabs_table";a:3:{i:0;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:72:"Innovative three-protagonist structure leads to loads of amazing moments";}i:1;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:68:"Outstanding, multilayered heists and other missions across the world";}i:2;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:66:"Huge, gorgeous, varied open world packed with things to see and do";}}s:29:"gameszone_content_tabs_table_s";a:3:{i:0;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:67:"Women are portrayed as strippers, prostitutes, long-suffering wives";}i:1;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:77:"There’s a terrific contrast between the urban lives of Michael and Franklin";}i:2;a:1:{s:9:"tab_title";s:81:"Great vehicle handling makes traveling the world a pleasent and joyful experience";}}s:19:"gameszone_hide_title";s:5:"false";s:23:"gameszone_content_on_top";s:0:"";s:20:"gameszone_content_top";s:0:"";s:23:"gameszone_content_bottom";s:141:"[raw][section sect=&quot;row&quot; bg=&quot;white&quot; row=&quot;default&quot;][sliders slider_id=&quot;535a4d494f4ae&quot;][/section][/raw]";s:18:"gameszone_seo_title";s:0:"";s:24:"gameszone_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
				<title>GTA 5 Reviews (PS3)</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=gta-5-reviews-ps3-12</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 01 Apr 2014 07:22:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=915</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Saints Row 4</title>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=464</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

				<title>Bioshock Infinite</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=bioshock-infinite</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:10:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=465</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>

                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it.                                     <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt="">

                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city.                                     <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

				<title>Bioshock Infinite Review</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=bioshock-infinite-review</link>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media...                                     <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Grand Theft Auto Online will be down for maintenance for the best part of Thursday, Rockstar Games has announced. The online game will be taken offline from 2am GMT tomorrow]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Dishonored</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=dishonored</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:16:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=467</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Dishonored Release</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=dishonored-release</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:19:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=469</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>

If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

	<item>
				<title>Max Payne 3 Reviews</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=max-payne-3-reviews</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:24:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=471</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Mass Effect 3</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=mass-effect-3</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:27:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=472</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Mass Effect 3 Review</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=mass-effect-3-review</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:30:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=473</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. 	<item>
				<title>LA Noire Release</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=la-noire-release</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:36:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=475</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Little Big Planet 2 d</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=little-big-planet-2-d</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:38:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=476</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Batman Arkum City</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=batman-arkum-city</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:44:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=478</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Red Dead Redemption</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=red-dead-redemption</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 May 2014 09:46:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=479</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor.]]></excerpt:encoded>

				<title>Grand Theft Auto Online Review</title>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality.                                     <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

				<title>Grand Theft Auto Online Review</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=grand-theft-auto-online-review-8</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Apr 2014 07:16:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=912</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media...                                     <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it.                                     <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>GTA 5 Reviews (PS3)</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=gta-5-reviews-ps3-11</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Apr 2014 07:18:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=913</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>Grand Theft Auto Online Review</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=grand-theft-auto-online-review-9</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Apr 2014 07:20:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://test.themefuse.com/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=914</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

	<item>
				<title>The Transformers: Dark of the Moon</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?review=the-transformers-dark-of-the-moon</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 May 2014 06:38:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=301</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city. Driving is so much fun that you’ll likely enjoy crossing even great distances in the game’s large world, taking in everything from the artwork on buildings along Vespucci Beach to the setting sun reflecting on the Alamo Sea. Should you tire of commuting across Los Santos, however, you can call a cab and warp to your. </p>

                                    <p>When shooting breaks out, as it often does in the lives of these criminals, you have a terrific variety of weapons at your disposal that you can customize with suppressors, scopes, flashlights and other doodads. By default, your aim snaps to enemies. This makes picking them off quite easy, but gunplay is a lot of fun despite the ease of aiming, because you’re regularly fending off so many attackers and you still need to make good use of cover to stay alive. If you’re looking for more challenging shooting, you can switch to an aim assist option or to free aim at any time.</p>

                                    <p><img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_1.jpg" alt=""></p>

                                    <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>
]]></content:encoded>

				<title>NBA 2K12 (EA Sports)</title>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/gameszone/?post_type=review&#038;p=306</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent, wickedly comic, and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary, post-economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire: it rips into the Millennial generation, celebrities, the far right, the far left, the middle class, the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar’s sharp tongue, including modern video games.</p>
                                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                                    <p>It’s not exactly subtle – he literally has the word “Entitled” tattooed on his neck, and the in-game radio and TV’s outright piss-takes don’t leave much to the imagination – but it is often extremely funny, and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto’s San Andreas is a fantasy, but the things it satirises – greed, corruption, hypocrisy, the abuse of power – are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream, GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.</p>

                                    <img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/img_big_2.jpg" alt="">

                                    <h2>Gameplay</h2>
                                    <p>Whether you’re evading the police in a rickety junker or a road-hugging sports car, the handling in GTA V is great, and the fact that vehicles feel so different from each other means there’s a real reason to store the cars you like in the garages at your characters’ homes or in ones you can purchase in the city.
